scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This folder comprises letters to John Wesley Hunt of Lexington, Kentucky, from his family; a work of writing in memory of Eleanor Murdock; and an indenture between Eleanor Hart and John W. Hunt assigning him 112 acres of land as collateral for a $1000 loan. Letters from Hunt's wife, Catherine G., and his daughter Catherine detail their trip to Philadelphia, Pennsylvania to visit his family. Hunt's nephew, Westley P. Hunt, and brother Wilson wrote to inform him of his brother Pearson's serious illness. John W. Hunt's son, John, thanked him for covering his debts but now has more debts.
